contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=January 2013}} {|{{Infobox ship begin}} {{Infobox ship image |Ship image=[[Image:NH-53613 USS H-9 underway, circa 1922 (cropped).jpg|300px|USS ''H-9'' underway, circa 1922]] |Ship caption=USS ''H-9'' underway, circa 1922 }} {{Infobox Ship Career |Hide header= |Ship country= |Ship flag={{USN flag|1922}} |Ship name=USS ''H-9'' |Ship namesake= |Ship ordered=by the [[Imperial Russian Navy]], 1915 |Ship builder=[[Puget Sound Navy Yard]], [[Bremerton, Washington]] |Ship laid down=1 June 1918 |Ship launched=23 November 1918 |Ship acquired= |Ship commissioned=25 November 1918 |Ship decommissioned=3 November 1922 |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship struck=26 February 1931 |Ship renamed= |Ship reclassified=SS-152, 15 July 1920 |Ship homeport= |Ship motto= |Ship nickname= |Ship honors= |Ship fate=Sold for scrapping, 28 November 1933 |Ship status= |Ship notes= }} {{Infobox ship characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship type=[[United States H class submarine|''H''-class]] [[submarine]] |Ship displacement={{convert|358|LT|t|abbr=on}} surfaced <br/> {{convert|467|LT|t|abbr=on}} submerged |Ship length={{convert|150|ft|4|in|m|abbr=on}} |Ship beam={{convert|15|ft|10|in|m|abbr=on}} |Ship draft={{convert|12|ft|5|in|m|abbr=on}} |Ship power={{convert|950|hp|kW|lk=in|abbr=on}} (diesel engines) <br/> {{convert|600|hp|kW|abbr=on}} (electric motors) |Ship propulsion=2 × [[New London Ship and Engine Company|New London Ship & Engine Co.]] [[diesel engine]]s <br/> 2 × Electro Dynamic Co. [[electric motor]]s <br/> 2 × shafts |Ship speed={{convert|14|kn|mph km/h|lk=in|abbr=on}} surfaced<br/> {{convert|10.5|kn|mph km/h|abbr=on}} submerged |Ship range= |Ship test depth={{convert|200|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship complement=25 officers and men |Ship armament=4 × {{convert|18|in|mm|abbr=on}} [[torpedo tube]]s (8 × [[torpedo]]es) |Ship notes= }} |} '''USS ''H-9'' (SS-152)''' was an [[United States H class submarine|''H''-class]] [[submarine]] that was on active duty with the [[United States Navy]] from 1918-1922. The [[Imperial Russian Navy]] ordered 18 ''H''-class submarines from the [[Electric Boat]] Company in 1915. Eleven were delivered, and served as the [[American Holland class submarines]], but shipment of the final six was held up pending the outcome of the [[Russian Revolution (1917)|Russian Revolution of 1917]], and the boats were stored in knockdown condition at [[Vancouver, British Columbia]]. All six were purchased by the [[United States Navy]] on 20 May 1918 and assembled at [[Puget Sound Navy Yard]]. ''H-9'' was [[ship naming and launching|launched]] on 23 November 1918 and [[ship commissioning|commissioned]] on 25 November with [[Lieutenant]] Clarke Withers in command. Joining Submarine Division 6 (SubDiv 6) at [[San Pedro, California]], and later being transferred to SubDiv 7 there, ''H-9'' participated in a variety of battle and training exercises along the West Coast. She also patrolled off [[Santa Catalina Island, California|Santa Catalina Island]], and put in at [[Mare Island]] for periodic overhauls. [[Image:NH-53612 USS H-9 submerging, circa 1922 (cropped).jpg|thumb|left|250 px|US ''H-9'' submerging.]] ''H-9'' sailed from San Pedro on 25 July 1922 and arrived in [[Norfolk, Virginia]] on 14 September, with SubDivs 6 and 7. The submarine decommissioned at Norfolk on 3 November. Her name was struck from the [[Naval Vessel Register]] on 26 February 1931. She was sold for scrapping on 28 November 1933. ==References== *{{DANFS|http://www.history.navy.mil/danfs/h1/H-9.htm}} ==External links== *{{navsource|08/08152|USS H-9}} {{United States H class submarine}} {{DEFAULTSORT:H-9 (SS-152)}} [[Category:United States H-class submarines]] [[Category:Ships built in Washington (state)]] [[Category:1918 ships]] {{US-submarine-stub}}
